Quantum-correlated ψ(3770) → D D decays collected by the CLEO-c experiment are used to perform first
measurements of F + , the fractional CP-even content of the self-conjugate decays D → π + π − π 0 and
D → K + K − π 0 . Values of 0.968 ± 0.017 ± 0.006 and 0.731 ± 0.058 ± 0.021 are obtained for π + π − π 0
and K + K − π 0 , respectively. It is demonstrated how modes of this sort can be cleanly included in
measurements of the unitarity triangle angle γ using B ∓ → D K ∓ decays. The high CP-even content
of D → π + π − π 0 , in particular, makes this a promising mode for improving the precision on γ .
